qas.question: Ibn Sina's Book of Healing was partially available in what language?
How many years did it take for Ibn Sina's Book of Healing to be available in Latin?
On what continent was the Book of Healing finally available fifty years after its composition?
What was the title of Ibn Sina's Book of Healing?
Who did Avicenna's metaphysics works have an influence on?
What book of healing did Ibn Sina write in Latin?
What did the 12th century Parisian decrees suppresse?
What did Latin Avicennism replace in Europe?
Who impacted Ibn Sina's thoughts on metaphysics?

plausible_answers.text: William of Auvergne, Bishop of Paris

qas.question: What  Bishop studied under Ibn Sina?
Ibn Sina's Book of Healing was fully available in what language?
How many months did it take for Ibn Sina's Book of Healing to be available in Latin?
On what continent was the Book of Healing finally available forty years after its composition?
What was the title of Ibn Sina's Tape of Healing?
Who did Avicenna's metaphysics works have no influence on?

context: His Book of Healing became available in <a2_0><b12_0>Europe<b12_0/><a2_0/> in partial <a0_0><b10_0>Latin<b10_0/><a0_0/> translation some <a1_0><b11_0>fifty<b11_0/><a1_0/> years after its composition, under the title <a3_0><b5_0><b13_0>Sufficientia<b13_0/><b5_0/><a3_0/>, and some authors have identified a <b6_0>"Latin Avicennism"<b6_0/> as flourishing for some time, paralleling the more influential <b7_0>Latin Averroism<b7_0/>, but suppressed by the Parisian decrees of 1210 and 1215. Avicenna's psychology and theory of knowledge influenced <b9_0>William of Auvergne, Bishop of Paris<b9_0/> and Albertus Magnus, while his metaphysics had an impact on the thought of <a4_0><b8_0><b14_0>Thomas Aquinas<b14_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/>.
